crypto.name: Baby RSA 1
crypto.desc: You think your Algebra skills are pretty good huh? Well let's test it out.

crypto.name: Baby RSA 2
crypto.desc: If all I have to do is keep my factors p and q secret, then I can save computation time by sharing the same modulus between all my friends. I'll give them unique e and d pairs to encrypt and decrypt messages. Sounds secure to me!

crypto.name: Cantors Pairadox
crypto.desc: Now that I have encrypted my flag with a new math function I was just researching I can know share it with my friend Cantor and no one will know how to read it except us!

crypto.name: Guess Me If You Can
crypto.desc: Check out the note-taking app I created! I heard users are really bad at picking passwords, so I made a really really secure number generator to give users passwords! Good luck trying to break it now.

crypto.name: Jokesmith
crypto.desc: Test your comedy skills with my new AI powered chatbot!

crypto.name: The Birds
crypto.desc: You think you're being watched, and you see a suspicious flock of birds on the powerlines outside of your house each morning. You think the feds are trying to tell you something. Separate words with underscores and encase in DawgCTF{}. All lowercase.

crypto.name: The Fractalist
crypto.desc: Math and science are powerful tools, but imagination might be the key to success.

crypto.name: The MAC FAC
crypto.desc: Check out my new MAC generator! I know you are supposed to use random and secret IVs in CBC-AES mode, so I decided to improve upon standard MACs by implementing that. Good luck trying to forge any messages now!

forensic.name: Chunked Integrity
forensic.desc: This is one of my favorite images! Unfortunately something has gone wrong and I cant see the whole thing, can you help fix it?

forensic.name: I Am Very Good At Music Theory
forensic.desc: "I don't think a violin can play all that" —[redacted], 2020

forensic.name: I LoveSpongeBob
forensic.desc: Do you think this is a real recording? It sounds like its missing somethin

forensic.name: Keeping on Schedule
forensic.desc:
One of our computers on the company network had some malware on it. We think we cleared of the main payload however it came back. Can you check for any signs of persistence? We are able to provide you a copy of the registry, the sooner the better!

For any registry related challenges, make sure to not overwrite you machines used registry as it is a sensitive system.

forensic.name: Keeping on Schedule Forensics
forensic.desc:
One of our computers on the company network had some malware on it. We think we cleared of the main payload however it came back. Can you check for any signs of persistence? We are able to provide you a copy of the registry, the sooner the better!

For any registry related challenges, make sure to not overwrite you machines used registry as it is a sensitive system.

forensic.name: Stingray Sniper
forensic.desc:
My Rayhunter has only been in operation for about 3 months, yet it's alerted 4 times! The EFF warns that Rayhunter packet captures "may contain sensitive information such as your IMSI and the unique IDs of cell towers you were near which could be used to ascertain your location at the time". Think you can figure out where I was when my Rayhunter alerted?

Flag format: DawgCTF{IMSI_IMEI_zipcode}

forensic.name: pinpoint 1
forensic.desc: I use a plastic card and pin to log in for work. I seem to have forgotten it and the process to change it is a real hassle. Luckily I capture the USB interfaces on my computer for this very reason! Can you recover my pin from this capture? Wrap the pin in DawgCTF{}

forensic.name: pinpoint 2
forensic.desc: I installed a new program that is supposed to use my card to login, however it says something about a clocking speed error. Can you figure out the clock rate conversion value for my card so I may better tune my program? Flag format: DawgCTF{base10 value}

misc.name: ASK Me Again
misc.desc: When playing around with your SDR, you found this weird signal. Decode it and get the flag!

misc.name: Brick House
misc.desc: I was going through some old tapes from the '80s and came across a strange recording on one labeled "Basic Programs #1." Any idea what it might be?

misc.name: Cipher For Good
misc.desc: A fellow computer scientist (Bob) crafted this new (old) cipher and sent it over for us to try and crack. Can you help us recover the original message from Bob.

misc.name: Dont Touch My Fone
misc.desc: Looks like someone's dialing a phone number, see if you can figure out what it is! The flag format is the decoded phone number wrapped in DawgCTF{} with no formatting, so if the number is 123-456-7890, then the flag is DawgCTF{1234567890}.

misc.name: Lydias New Code
misc.desc: Hey, we intercepted this secret message from the city of Sardis. Help us crack the code!🕵️

misc.name: My Cat Trashed My File
misc.desc: I had a super important file open in my editor when my cat decided to take a stroll across my keyboard. He managed to smash a bunch of keys, and now the file looks like digital spaghetti. Fortunately, I had a chat with the little troublemaker and got a full confession for exactly which keys he pressed. If you can help me recover the file, I’ll be eternally grateful (and so will my cat, who’s currently on thin ice)!

misc.name: Mystery Signal I
misc.desc: I was listening to my scanner when I heard a strange signal. Can you decode it?

misc.name: Mystery Signal II
misc.desc: I was listening to my scanner when I heard a strange signal. Can you decode it?

misc.name: Spectral Secrets
misc.desc: I was downloading some music from Limewire and came across a strange file. Can you help me figure out what it is?

misc.name: Yin and Yang
misc.desc: From ancient philosophy to modern thought, Yin and Yang represents balance, duality, and the harmony of opposites. Hidden within this image lies a secret that embodies these principles. Can you find equilibrium within the chaos?

net.name: Someones at the door
Space Game 1
net.desc: Hey dude! I made this cool space game, but I only had time to make a server, not the client. Can you help me out? Read this documentation for instructions.

net.name: Space Game 2
net.desc: (Assuming you already did Space Game 1) Whoa dude! Thanks for making this! BTW, I made my own client. I'm chilling in sector (15,2), want to come and meet me?

osint.name: Magnum Opus
osint.desc: I was watching a chess game, and was wowed extremely with the positional thinking I saw from white. I had to step away, unfortunately.... that was a long time ago, and I still want to see how the game developed. Given the first few moves which I wrote down, can you find out what this game was called?

pwn.name: 64 bits in my Ark and Texture
pwn.desc: Can you pwn it? No libc or system needed. Just good ol, 64 bit binary exploitation.

pwn.name: Clobber
pwn.desc: I lost my pop rdi gadget for a libc leak... can you help me puts together a new one?

pwn.name: Interns Project
pwn.desc: Our interns put together a little test program for us. It seems they all might have patched together their separate projects. Could you test it out for me?

pwn.name: Just Parry Lol
pwn.desc:
Welcome, warrior. Inspired by his favorite game, For Honor, my friend made a turn-based combat simulator to familiarize people with frame data. However, the system is against you. Every move you make is just too slow. You have one secret tool: the ability to manipulate time.

Can you win the fight and retrieve the flag?

rev.name: Evanesco
rev.desc: I was in my chambers brewing a new flag, but at the last moment I spilled my invisibility potion all over it! Can you find it for me?

rev.name: ShinyClean Rust Remover Budget Edition
rev.desc: ShinyClean™ Rust Remover is having a free car wash give away! Run the program to see if you win!

rev.name: ShinyClean Rust Remover Club Edition
rev.desc: ShinyClean™ Rust Remover club exclusive deal! Enter your code in the checker program to see if you won a free car!

rev.name: ShinyClean Rust Remover Pro Edition
rev.desc: ShinyClean™ Rust Remover pro alert! Can you complete the challenge to win a lifetime supply of ShinyClean™ Rust Remover?

rev.name: Suspicious script
rev.desc:
I was on a site looking for homework help. They offer this tool that I installed and they suggest running it to help solve my assignment. The file ends in .ps1 and I am unfamiliar with it. Can you check it out for me?

The flag starts with DawgCTF{...}

rev.name: Web challenge
rev.desc: I tried to put this in the web category, but the organizers said I had to move it to rev? C'mon, it literally has "web" in the name!

web.name: 4spam
web.desc:
In the wake of last week's events, we've created a replacement.

An old dump of some of the code is available under the name 4spam. The flag is at /flag.txt.

web.name: Arrr Wheres My Treasure
web.desc: There are many treasures out at sea, you just have to know how to read the map.
